sections.title: Microtubules

requirement_evaluations.applicability_reasoning: This section does not pertain to infobox usage. It is about the interactions of Anillin with microtubules.
Infoboxes should summarize key facts, which is not relevant to the content of this section discussing microtubule interactions.
This requirement applies to the inclusion of infoboxes in articles, which does not pertain to the specific content of this section.
This section focuses on the biological functions associated with microtubules rather than infobox requirements.
This requirement is relevant for protein family articles, not for contents related to Anillin's binding partners.
The section does not discuss proteins without human orthologs in the context needed for infobox considerations.
Applicable for Pfam-oriented content, not relevant to the discussion on Anillin interactions with microtubules.
Enzymatic roles and EC numbers are not discussed in this section, making this requirement irrelevant.
The content does not address a single human paralog assigned to an EC number; thus, this is not relevant.
The section does not involve assignment to a Pfam family pertinent to the evaluation of infoboxes.
The section does not utilize multiple infoboxes, making this requirement inapplicable.
There are no infobox tables present or discussed in this section.

sections.meta_notes: This section focuses on Anillin's interaction with microtubules and does not relate to the usage or evaluation of infoboxes.
